docs.snippet: India on Monday launched its first internet hotline to encourage people to report online child pornography and curb a surge in photographs and videos on the internet showing children being sexually exploited, the founders of the initiative said.

headline.print_headline: India Launches First Internet Hotline to Tackle Surge in Child Porn
headline.main: India Launches First Internet Hotline to Tackle Surge in Child Porn

docs.snippet: The “Today” host is negotiating his departure after the release of a video in which he cheered on Donald J. Trump as he made vulgar comments about women.

headline.print_headline: ‘Today’ Host Discussing NBC Exit After Lewd Tape
headline.main: Billy Bush Negotiating Exit From NBC After Lewd Tape

docs.snippet: France and Germany want to compel operators of mobile messaging services to provide access to encrypted content to terrorism investigations, after a series of deadly attacks in both countries.

headline.print_headline: France, Germany Press for Access to Encrypted Messages After Attacks
headline.main: France, Germany Press for Access to Encrypted Messages After Attacks

docs.snippet: Next year we are all going green, according to the Pantone Color Institute. Here’s why.

headline.main: Color of 2017? Pantone Picks a Spring Shade

docs.snippet: Questions about how news outlets reported, or didn’t report, on a rape and murder suspect from Afghanistan underscored a rift over Chancellor Angela Merkel’s policy on newcomers.

headline.print_headline: News Coverage of Refugee’s Arrest Divides Germany
headline.main: Refugee’s Arrest Turns a Crime Into National News (and Debate) in Germany

docs.snippet: Traffic on the way to a star-studded gala? This culture reporter grabs his sports jacket and hops on a bicycle.

headline.print_headline: It’s a Wrap: Covering the Toronto Film Festival
headline.main: It’s a Wrap: Covering the Toronto Film Festival

docs.snippet: Donald Trump on Monday put the claim that Bill Clinton was a sexual predator whose wife attacked the victims at the center of his flailing presidential campaign, insisting his own vulgar words about women in 2005 weren't as bad as the Clintons' al...

headline.print_headline: Trump Puts Clinton Sex Abuse Claims at Center of Campaign
headline.main: Trump Puts Clinton Sex Abuse Claims at Center of Campaign

docs.snippet: Shortages of sugar, a staple of the national diet, and of other products have led to brewing anger against President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

headline.print_headline: Sweet-Toothed Egypt  Endures a Sugar Crisis
headline.main: Sweet-Toothed Egypt Endures a Sugar Crisis: ‘People Are Going to Snap’

docs.abstract: Outrage over sugar shortage in Egypt underscores country's dependence on subsidized staple, and indexes broader discontent with Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi's leadership; longstanding government subsidies for range of products is jeopardized by economy still reeling from 2011 protests that toppled previous regime.

docs.snippet: Photos from Syria, Mexico, China and South Korea.
docs.abstract: Photos from Syria, Mexico, China and South Korea.

docs.snippet: Some artists and fans had expressed concern on social media about how the musical was being cast, although no long-term casting commitments were made.

headline.print_headline: A ‘Prince of Egypt’ Performance Is Canceled
headline.main: ‘Prince of Egypt’ Musical Reading Canceled After Diversity Complaints

docs.abstract: Bay Street Theater and DreamWorks cancel free concert reading of musical The Prince of Egypt after artists and fans expressed displeasure over cast of mostly white actors.
